blocks.value: Saint Maria Goretti was an Italian girl who became a martyr of purity at age 11. She is the patron saint of youth, teenage girls, victims of rape, and forgiveness.

In 1902, a 19-year-old neighbor, Alessandro Serenelli, attempted to rape Maria. She resisted, crying out that it was a mortal sin and he would go to hell. Enraged, he stabbed her 14 times. She died the next day after forgiving him.

Before dying, Maria said: 'I forgive Alessandro and want him to be with me in heaven.' Alessandro repented in prison after Maria appeared to him in a vision. He attended her canonization in 1950. Maria's mother also publicly forgave him.
